page.title: 08FENCE AFTER THE 1945 WAR
page.content: Did lots of village people join up? {About 15.}Were there pubs in Fence? {There was about 4 pubs in Fence. There was just a track where the bypass is today.What was the school like?{There was about 40 children, 2 {teachers and one room.}Were there any shops?{There was a co-op and wagon {with fruit and veg came around.}What was the dress like.{Short trousers and {no jeans.}Were the buses more relible ?{Yes ,they were.}What did people do?{They worked in the mill.}What did Fence do on the VE day? {We hung up flags. About 6 evacuees {came to Fence.Fence made bomb shelters {along the mill.Some food was a bit {scarce E.G. fruit,butter,sweets.After {the war a captain Astly offered the {men a watch but they bought a field ; {today its called Pendle Fields .It is {still used today.
